H0.text: Plants that can live in sandy soils most likely have the ability to withstand fires.

H1.text: Salt is what plants that can live in sandy soils most likely have the ability to withstand.

H2.text: Cold temperatures are the ability that plants capable of living in sandy soils most likely possess.

H3.text: Dry conditions are the ability that plants that can live in sandy soils most likely have to withstand.

A4.text: Halophytes and xerophytes evolved to survive in such environments.

A5.text: Xerophytic plants exhibit a diversity of specialized adaptations to survive in such water-limiting conditions.

A6.text: Plants in naturally arid conditions retain large amounts of biomass due to drought tolerance.

A7.text: Overexpression of these genes enhance the tolerance of drought, high salinity, and low temperature in transgenic lines from Arabidopsis, rice, and tobacco.
